Class TextShape

All Implemented Interfaces:
SilShape
Direct Known Subclasses:
EditableTextShape
public class TextShape
extends BoxShape

TextShape is a non-editable line of text drawn on the screen. In addition to the normal properties of a Silhouette BoxShape, a Text Shape also has the following properties:

  1. Text: the string to be displayed.
  2. Font: the font in which the string will be drawn.

y_in - the y coordinate of the border bounding box
text_in - the string to be displayed
Method Detail

getWidth

public double getWidth()
Returns the width of the text shape. If the width cannot be determined, then 0 is returned. One reason the width might not be determinable is because the text shape has not yet been added to a canvas or the canvas has not yet been displayed.
Overrides:
getWidth in class BoxShape

getHeight

public double getHeight()
Description copied from class: BoxShape
Returns the height of the rectangular shape
Overrides:
getHeight in class BoxShape

draw

public void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
Paints a text shape to the screen. This method should never be called directly by an application. To get a text shape to appear on the screen, either add it to a Silhouette canvas or to a composite shape that has been added to a Silhouette canvas.
Overrides:
draw in class AbstractSilShape

setFontStats

public static java.awt.font.FontRenderContext setFontStats(java.awt.font.FontRenderContext contextIn)
Sets the fontStats variable. This method is ordinarily called by a canvas's paint method and should not have to be called directly by the application.
